CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDSeBT
2. PC71BM
3. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
4. J SC (Short-Circuit Current Density)
5. V OC (Open-Circuit Voltage)
6. FF (Fill Factor)
7. PCDTBT
8. Si
9. SiO2
10. OTS (Octadecyltrichlorosilane)
11. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide)
12. PEDOT : PSS (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate))
13. Al
14. AM 1.5G
15. IPCE (Incident Photon-to-Current Efficiency)
16. AFM (Atomic Force Microscopy)

The other entities mentioned, such as "PCs", "BHJ", "weight ratio", "w/w", "blend solutions", "reference cell", "OTS-treated Si/SiO2 substrates", "linear-regime transfer characteristics", "on/off current ratio", "AM 1.5G reference spectrum", and "AFM" do not clearly refer to material names.

In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCE (Percentage of efficiency) of the initial device: 0.73%
2. J SC (Short-circuit current density) of the initial device: 2.98 mA / cm^2
3. V OC (Open-circuit voltage) of the initial device: 0.71 V
4. FF (Fill factor) of the initial device: 35%
5. PCE of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 4.12%
6. J SC of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 11.7 mA / cm^2
7. V OC of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 0.79 V
8. FF of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 45%
9. J SC of PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues (reported in literature): 1.0 × 10^-3 to 4.0 × 10^4 -13 mA / cm^2
10. I on / I off (On-current / Off-current) ratio: N/A (not provided in the paragraph)
11. IPCE (Incident photon-to-current efficiency) at the energetically lower peak: over 65%
12. J SC calculated from IPCE data: N/A (not provided in the paragraph)

| Property Value |
|---------------|
| PCE of initial device: 0.73% |
| J SC of initial device: 2.98 mA / cm^2 |
| V OC of initial device: 0.71 V |
| FF of initial device: 35% |
| PCE of optimized device: 4.12% |
| J SC of optimized device: 11.7 mA / cm^2 |
| V OC of optimized device: 0.79 V |
| FF of optimized device: 45% |
| J SC of PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues: 1.0 × 10^-3 to 4.0 × 10^4 -13 mA / cm^2 |
| IPCE at the energetically lower peak: over 65% |
